commentary_on_process:
To solve the problem, I first identified the relevant information, which was the racial makeup of the town. Then, I broke down the problem into smaller parts by calculating the percentage of the two largest racial groups combined and the percentage of the three smallest racial groups combined, and then finding the difference between the two percentages. 

I believe this was the most straightforward and efficient way to solve the problem given the information provided. However, if the problem had included more racial groups, it might have been more efficient to group them into larger categories to simplify the calculations.
problem_text:
Context:
As of the census of 2010, there were 4,855 people, 1,976 households, and 1,271 families residing in the town. The population density was 93.6 inhabitants per square mile . There were 2,478 housing units at an average density of 47.8 per square mile . The racial makeup of the town was 97.5% White, 0.4% African American, 0.6% Native American, 0.4% Asian, and 1.1% from two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 0.9% of the population. There were 1,976 households of which 27.7% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 49.1% were married couples living together, 9.9% had a female householder with no husband present, 5.3% had a male householder with no wife present, and 35.7% were non-families. 28.9% of all households were made up of individuals and 13.5% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.32 and the average family size was 2.82. The median age in the town was 44 years. 20.8% of residents were under the age of 18; 6.4% were between the ages of 18 and 24; 24.2% were from 25 to 44; 30.6% were from 45 to 64; and 18.2% were 65 years of age or older. The gender makeup of the town was 50.6% male and 49.4% female.

Question:
How many more people, in terms of percentage, were in the two largest racial groups combined compared to the three smallest racial groups combined?

steps.step_response: The relevant information is the racial makeup of the town, which states that the town is 97.5% White, 0.4% African American, 0.6% Native American, 0.4% Asian, and 1.1% from two or more races.

steps.step_response:
The two largest racial groups are White and two or more races, which make up 97.5% and 1.1% of the population, respectively. Therefore, the two largest racial groups combined make up 98.6% of the population. 

The three smallest racial groups are African American, Native American, and Asian, which make up 0.4%, 0.6%, and 0.4% of the population, respectively. Therefore, the three smallest racial groups combined make up 1.4% of the population. 

The difference between the two percentages is 98.6% - 1.4% = 97.2%. Therefore, the two largest racial groups combined make up 97.2% more of the population than the three smallest racial groups combined.
